name: g
description: The base command for all Git commands.

name: ga
description: Add file contents to the index.

name: gaa
description: Add all changes (new, modified, and removed files) to the staging area.

name: gapa
description: Interactively select hunks of patch to add to the index.

name: gau
description: Update the index just where it already has an entry matching <pathspec>.

name: gav
description: Be verbose when adding files to the index.

name: gwip
command: git add -A; git rm $(git ls-files --deleted) 2> /dev/null; git commit --no-verify --no-gpg-sign -m "--wip-- [skip ci]"
description: Save all changes to a new commit with a message indicating 'work in progress'.

name: gam
description: Apply a series of patches from a mailbox to the current branch.

name: gama
description: Abort the current patching operation and restore the pre-apply state.

name: gamc
description: Resolve conflicts and resume the patching operation.

name: gamscp
description: Show the current patch being applied.

name: gams
description: Skip the current patch and continue applying the rest.

name: gap
description: Apply a patch without committing it.

name: gapt
description: Attempt a three-way merge if the patch does not apply cleanly.

name: gbs
description: Use binary search to find the commit that introduced a bug.

name: gbsb
description: Mark the current commit as bad (containing the bug).

name: gbsg
description: Mark the current commit as good (not containing the bug).

name: gbsr
description: Reset bisect state and return to the original branch.

name: gbss
description: Start bisect session to find the commit that introduced a bug.

name: gbl
description: Show what revision and author last modified each line of a file.

name: gb
description: List, create, or delete branches.

name: gbda
command: git branch --no-color --merged | command grep -vE "^([+*]|\s*($(git_main_branch)|$(git_develop_branch))\s*$)" | command xargs git branch -d 2>/dev/null
description: Delete merged branches except main and develop.

name: gbnm
description: List branches that have not merged into the current branch.

name: gbr
description: List remote-tracking branches.

name: gba
description: List both local and remote branches.

name: gbd
description: Delete a fully merged branch.

name: gbD
description: Forcefully delete a branch, even if it has unmerged changes.

name: gco
description: Switch branches or restore working tree files.

name: gcor
description: Switch branches or restore working tree files with submodule support.

name: gcb
description: Create a new branch and switch to it.

name: gcd
description: Switch to the develop branch.

name: gch
description: Switch to a hotfix branch.

name: gcr
description: Switch to a release branch.

name: gcm
description: Switch to the main branch.

name: gcp
description: Cherry-pick a commit from another branch.

name: gcpa
description: Abort the cherry-pick operation and restore the original branch state.

name: gcpc
description: Continue the cherry-pick operation after resolving conflicts.

name: gclean
description: Interactively clean the working directory.

name: gcl
description: Clone a repository and initialize its submodules.

name: gcam
description: Record changes to the repository with a commit message.

name: gcas
description: Record changes to the repository with a sign-off.

name: gcasm
description: Record changes to the repository with a sign-off and commit message.

name: gcmsg
description: Record changes to the repository with a commit message.

name: gcs
description: Record changes to the repository and sign the commit.

name: gcsm
description: Sign the commit and add a sign-off line to the end of the commit message.

name: gcss
description: Sign the commit and add a sign-off line to the end of the commit message.

name: gcssm
description: Record changes to the repository, sign the commit, and add a sign-off line.

name: gc
description: Record changes to the repository.

name: gc!
description: Amend the last commit with the current changes.

name: gcn
description: Record changes to the repository without editing the commit message.

name: gcn!
description: Amend the last commit without editing the commit message.

name: gca
description: Record changes to the repository (including file deletions) without staging explicitly.

name: gca!
description: Amend the last commit with the current changes, including file deletions.

name: gcan!
description: Amend the last commit without editing the commit message.

name: gcans!
description: Amend the last commit as a signed commit without editing the commit message.

name: gcf
description: List all Git configuration settings.

name: gd
description: Show changes between commits, commit and working tree, etc.

name: gdca
description: Show changes between the index and the previous commit.

name: gdcw
description: Show word diff between the index and the previous commit.

name: gds
description: Show the differences between the staged changes and the previous commit.

name: gdw
description: Show word diff between the working tree and the index or a tree.

name: gdup
description: Show changes between the working tree and the upstream branch.

name: gdt
description: Show changes between two tree objects (e.g., between commits and trees).

name: gf
description: Download objects and refs from a remote repository.

name: gfo
description: Fetch from the origin remote repository.

name: gfl
description: A collection of Git extensions for high-level repository operations.

name: gflf
description: Manage feature branches in Git Flow.

name: gflff
description: Finish a feature branch and merge it into the develop branch.

name: gflffc
description: Finish the current feature branch and merge it into the develop branch.

name: gflfp
description: Publish a feature branch to the remote repository.

name: gflfpc
description: Publish the current feature branch to the remote repository.

name: gflfpll
description: Pull the latest changes of a feature branch from the remote repository.

name: gflfs
description: Start a new feature branch in Git Flow.

name: gflh
description: Manage hotfix branches in Git Flow.

name: gflhf
description: Finish a hotfix branch and merge it into the main branch.

name: gflhfc
description: Finish the current hotfix branch and merge it into the main branch.

name: gflhp
description: Publish a hotfix branch to the remote repository.

name: gflhpc
description: Publish the current hotfix branch to the remote repository.

name: gflhs
description: Start a new hotfix branch in Git Flow.

name: gfli
description: Initialize a new repository using Git Flow.

name: gflr
description: Manage release branches in Git Flow.

name: gflrf
description: Finish a release branch and merge it into the main and develop branches.

name: gflrfc
description: Finish the current release branch and merge it into the main and develop branches.

name: gflrp
description: Publish a release branch to the remote repository.

name: gflrpc
description: Publish the current release branch to the remote repository.

name: gflrs
description: Start a new release branch.

name: gg
description: Open a graphical commit tool to select changes for commit.

name: gga
description: Open a graphical commit tool to amend the last commit.

name: ghh
description: Display help information about Git commands.

name: glgg
description: Show commit history with a graph of branches and merges.

name: glgga
description: Show commit history with graph, decoration, and all references.

name: glo
description: Show commit history with one commit per line and decorations.

name: glog
description: Show commit history graph with one commit per line and decorations.

name: gloga
description: Show commit history graph with all references and decorations.

name: glg
description: Show commit history with statistics.

name: glgp
description: Show commit history with statistics and full diffs.

name: gunwip
command: git log -n 1 | grep -q -c "\--wip--" && git reset HEAD~1
description: Cancel the last commit if the commit message contains '--wip--'.

name: gignored
description: List ignored files.

name: gfg
description: List tracked files matching a pattern.

name: gm
description: Merge two or more development histories together.

name: gma
description: Abort the merge operation and restore the original branch state.

name: gmom
description: Merge changes from the main branch into the current branch.

name: gmum
description: Merge changes from an upstream main branch.

name: gmtl
description: Run merge conflict resolution tool to resolve conflicts.

name: gl
description: Fetch from and integrate with another repository or a local branch.

name: gpr
description: Fetch from a remote branch and rebase on the current branch.

name: gup
description: Fetch from a remote branch and rebase on the current branch.

name: gupa
description: Fetch from a remote branch and rebase with autostash set.

name: gupav
description: Fetch from a remote branch and rebase with verbose output and autostash.

name: gupv
description: Fetch from a remote branch and rebase with verbose output.

name: gupom
description: Rebase the current branch onto the upstream main branch.

name: ggpull
description: Pull the current branch from the remote repository and rebase.

name: gluc
description: Pull the current branch from an upstream repository.

name: glum
description: Pull the main branch from an upstream repository.

name: gp
description: Update remote refs along with associated objects.

name: gpd
description: Validate push without actually sending data.

name: gpf!
description: Forcefully update the remote branch without checking for diverging changes.

name: gpf
description: Update the remote branch with force iff there are no divergent changes.

name: gpsup
description: Push the current branch and set the upstream tracking branch.

name: gpv
description: Push to the remote repository with verbose output.

name: gpoat
command: git push origin --all && git push origin --tags
description: Push all local branches and tags to the remote repository.

name: ggpush
description: Push the current branch to the remote repository.

name: gpu
description: Push to an upstream remote repository.

name: grb
description: Reapply commits on top of another base tip.

name: grba
description: Abort the current rebase operation and restore the original branch state.

name: grbc
description: Continue the rebase operation after resolving conflicts.

name: grbo
description: Rebase commits onto another base, optionally skipping some commits.

name: grbs
description: Skip the current commit during the rebase.

name: grbi
description: Start an interactive rebase.

name: grbd
description: Rebase the current branch on top of the develop branch.

name: grbm
description: Rebase the current branch on top of the main branch.

name: grbom
description: Rebase from the main branch of the remote repository.

name: gr
description: Manage tracked repositories.

name: grv
description: Show remote repositories and their URLs.

name: gra
description: Add a remote repository.

name: grrm
description: Remove a remote repository.

name: grmv
description: Rename a remote repository.

name: grset
description: Change the URL of a remote repository.

name: grup
description: Fetch updates from all remote repositories.

name: grh
description: Reset the current HEAD to the specified state.

name: gru
description: Reset the current HEAD to the specified state but keep changes in the working directory.

name: grhh
description: Reset current HEAD to the specified state and discard changes in the working directory.

name: gpristine
description: Hard reset and clean working directory.

name: groh
description: Hard reset to the state of the remote tracking branch.

name: grs
description: Restore files in the working tree from the index or another source.

name: grss
description: Restore files from a specified source.

name: grst
description: Unstage changes from the index but keep them in the working directory.

name: grev
description: Reverse one or more commits.

name: grm
description: Remove files from the working tree and from the index.

name: grmc
description: Remove files from the index but keep them in the working directory.

name: gcount
description: Show the number of commits per author in descending order.

name: gsh
description: Show information about an object.

name: gstall
description: Save changes in the working tree and untracked files to a new stash.

name: gstaa
description: Apply the latest stash and keep it in the stash list.

name: gstc
description: Clear all stashes.

name: gstd
description: Drop the latest stash.

name: gstl
description: List all stashes.

name: gstp
description: Apply the latest stash and drop it from the stash list.

name: gsta
description: Save changes in the working tree to a new stash.

name: gsts
description: Show the diff of what is stored in the stash.

name: gst
description: Show the working tree status.

name: gss
description: Show the working tree status in short format.

name: gsb
description: Show the working tree status in a compact format.

name: gsi
description: Initialize the submodules recorded in .gitmodules.

name: gsu
description: Fetch and update the registered submodules.

name: gsd
description: Commit changes to the Subversion repository.

name: git-svn-dcommit-push
command: git svn dcommit && git push github $(git_main_branch):svntrunk
description: Dcommit to SVN and push to GitHub.

name: gsr
description: Rebase against upstream SVN changes.

name: gsw
description: Switch branches or restore working tree files.

name: gswc
description: Create a new branch and switch to it.

name: gswd
description: Switch to the development branch.

name: gswm
description: Switch to the main branch.

name: gts
description: Create a signed tag object.

name: gtv
description: List tags in version order.

name: gignore
description: Mark files as assume-unchanged.

name: gunignore
description: Stop ignoring changes to a file that is already tracked by Git.

name: gwt
description: Manage multiple working trees associated with the repository.

name: gwta
description: Add a new working tree.

name: gwtls
description: List all linked working trees.

name: gwtmv
description: Move a working tree to a new location.

name: gwtrm
description: Remove a working tree.

name: gbg
description: Shows local branches that have been deleted on the remote repository.

name: gbgD
command: git branch --no-color -vv | grep ": gone\]" | awk '{print $1}' | xargs git branch -D
description: Forcefully deletes local branches that have been deleted on the remote repository.

name: gbgd
command: git branch --no-color -vv | grep ": gone\]" | awk '{print $1}' | xargs git branch -d
description: Deletes local branches that have been deleted on the remote repository.

name: gdct
description: Shows the description of the most recent tag.

name: gfa
description: Downloads all branches and the latest changes from the remote repository.

name: ggsup
description: Sets the current branch to track the corresponding branch on the remote repository.

name: gk
description: Opens the GitK graphical interface to visualize commit history.

name: gke
description: Opens the GitK graphical interface and shows referenced commits.

name: glgm
description: Shows commit history in a graphical format, limited to the last 10 commits.

name: glod
description: Shows commit history in a detailed and colorful graphical format.

name: glods
description: Shows commit history in a detailed, colorful, and short date format graphical format.

name: glol
description: Shows commit history in a detailed graphical format along with relative dates.

name: glola
description: Shows commit history of all branches in a detailed graphical format along with relative dates.

name: glols
description: Shows commit history in a detailed graphical format along with relative dates and change statistics.

name: glp
description: Custom function to show commit history in a predefined format.

name: gms
description: Merges changes from one branch into another without creating a merge commit.

name: gmtlvim
description: Opens the Git merging tool in Vimdiff mode to resolve conflicts.

name: gpod
description: Deletes a branch from the remote repository.

name: gpsupf
description: Sends local changes to the remote repository and sets the corresponding branch to track.

name: grep
description: Searches for patterns in files or directories, excluding common directories.

name: grt
description: Navigates to the root directory of the current repository.

name: gsps
description: Shows detailed information about a specific commit and its digital signature, if any.

name: gtl
description: Shows tags matching a specific pattern and sorts them in descending version order.

name: gupomi
description: Updates the current branch by interactive rebase from the main branch of the remote repository.

name: gwch
description: Shows the changes made in each commit along with their summaries.

name: ggpnp
description: Pull changes from the remote repository for the current branch and push your changes to the remote repository.

name: ggpur
description: Pull changes from the remote repository for the current branch and rebase your changes on top of it.

name: gbsn
description: Start a git bisect session to find the commit that introduced a bug

name: gbso
description: Mark a commit as not containing the bug being bisected

name: gbm
description: Rename a git branch

name: gccd
description: Clone a Git repository recursively and change to the new directory

name: gdv
description: Show diff output for files in the working tree through an external pager

name: gdnolock
description: Show diff output excluding package-lock.json and other lock files

name: gprv
description: Pull with rebase from the remote repository verbosely

name: gpra
description: Pull with rebase from the remote repository, stashing local changes

name: gprav
description: Pull with rebase from remote verbosely, stashing local changes

name: gprom
description: Pull main branch from origin with rebase

name: gpromi
description: Interactively rebase main branch from origin

name: ggl
description: Pull the current branch from origin

name: ggf
description: Force push the current branch to origin

name: ggfl
description: Force push the current branch to origin if you have the latest changes

name: ggp
description: Push the current branch to origin

name: grhk
description: Reset the index preserving working tree changes

name: grhs
description: Soft reset the index to a commit, keeping changes

name: gstu
description: Stash including untracked files

name: gta
description: Annotate a tag with the tagger name, email, date, and message

name: gcB
description: Create or reset a branch to the specified commit, switching to it.

name: gcann!
description: Amend the last commit with all current changes, using the current date, without editing the message.

name: gmc
description: Continue merging after resolving conflicts.

name: grf
description: Show a log of changes to the local repository's HEAD and branch references.

name: gwipe
description: Hard reset the working directory and clean it by forcefully removing untracked files and directories.

name: greva
description: Abort the revert operation, returning to the previous state before the revert began.

name: grevc
description: Continue the revert process after a merge conflict has been resolved.
